channel.title: I need VPS Help!
channel.description:
I've tried every solution someone has thrown at me and I still can't seem to run [b]any[/b] source on my CentOS VPS.
Can someone guide me through the process of making a server source compatible for Linux hosting?
Feel free to drop a reply or add me on MSN, I just want to get this figured out.
MSN: alex@forumsource.org
Edit: I forgot to state what the problem was.
I have transferred the server files onto my VPS and I'm using UltraVNC to control everything. If you're unfamiliar with UltraVNC, it's basically like remote desktop connection, though mainly used on Linux distributions. Anyways, once I locate the server files folder, I right click on it and click "Run Terminal Here". Before going on, I have made sure that I have a "run.sh" file, so that's not the problem. Once the terminal pops up, I type in the command "sh run.sh". It seems to run the server, but it tells me that several, if not all, of the ".cfg" files are missing.
Edit: I tried some different things and it seem as if the ".cfg" error disappeared, but now I received this error.
[code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotfoundException: server at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:217) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:205) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:319) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:294) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:264) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:332) Could not find the main class: server. Program will exit.[/code]

item.title: I need VPS Help!
item.dc:creator: @Amayzing Amayzing
item.description:
@Amayzing wrote:

I’ve tried every solution someone has thrown at me and I still can’t seem to run any source on my CentOS VPS.

Can someone guide me through the process of making a server source compatible for Linux hosting?

Feel free to drop a reply or add me on MSN, I just want to get this figured out.

MSN: alex@forumsource.org

Edit: I forgot to state what the problem was.

I have transferred the server files onto my VPS and I’m using UltraVNC to control everything. If you’re unfamiliar with UltraVNC, it’s basically like remote desktop connection, though mainly used on Linux distributions. Anyways, once I locate the server files folder, I right click on it and click “Run Terminal Here”. Before going on, I have made sure that I have a “run.sh” file, so that’s not the problem. Once the terminal pops up, I type in the command “sh run.sh”. It seems to run the server, but it tells me that several, if not all, of the “.cfg” files are missing.

Edit: I tried some different things and it seem as if the “.cfg” error disappeared, but now I received this error.

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotfoundException: server at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:217) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:205) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:319) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:294) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:264) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:332) Could not find the main class: server. Program will exit.

Read full topic
